/-- Let P be a permutation matrix (an n×n matrix obtained from the identity by permuting rows). Prove that det(P) ∈ { -1, 1 } (i.e., det P is ±1). Provide a Lean 4 / mathlib4 statement (no proof) ending with := by sorry, and import Mathlib at the top. Save into file jirilebl_ra_ch-several-vars-ders_2244.lean. -/
theorem det_eq_sign_of_isPerm {P : Matrix α α ℤ} (h : P.IsPerm) : P.det = ↑h.sign := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Equiv

variable {α : Type _} [Fintype α] [DecidableEq α]

/-- The permutation matrix associated to a permutation σ: entries are 1 where σ i = j and 0 otherwise. -/
def perm_matrix (σ : Perm α) : Matrix α α Int := fun i j => if σ i = j then 1 else 0

/-- The determinant of a permutation matrix is either -1 or 1. -/
theorem det_perm_matrix_is_plus_or_minus_one (σ : Perm α) : (perm_matrix σ).det ∈ ({-1, 1} : Set Int) := by sorry
